intro: Cabralea glaziovii, commonly known as the Glaziov's cabralea, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
